title: How to Use a Letterpress
content:
I have been given access to a letterpress shop. Interestingly, nobody else with access to the shop knows how to use it, and it hasn’t been used in years.

I know something about letterpress printing from reading books about printing, but I still think it’d be a really, really good idea to read in more detail about how to use the machines. I’m looking for recommendations of books about how to use a letterpress.

 [‹ Garamond...the original](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091425/http:/typophile.com/node/48942 "Go to previous forum topic") [Amsterdam for the weekend, any advice? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091425/http:/typophile.com/node/48914 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Thomas Levine

comments.content:
Tom, I wonder if there isn’t a workshop or a local letterpress that wouldn’t mind you hanging out to watch. I think you’d learn more from experience rather than books. ;^)

( Moving this thread to General Discussions. )

If you get serious about it (like if your geographic area is affluent...) and start using photopolymer plates for printing, do get a copy of “Printing Digital Type” by our Gerald Lange.

[http://bielerpress.blogspot.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091425/http:/bielerpress.blogspot.com/ "http://bielerpress.blogspot.com/")

[http://cgi.ebay.com/Printing-Digital-Type-Letterpress-Photopolymer-Manua...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091425/http:/cgi.ebay.com/Printing-Digital-Type-Letterpress-Photopolymer-Manual_W0QQitemZ190247080396QQihZ009QQcategoryZ46728QQssPageNameZWDVWQQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem "http://cgi.ebay.com/Printing-Digital-Type-Letterpress-Photopolymer-Manual\_W0QQitemZ190247080396QQihZ009QQcategoryZ46728QQssPageNameZWDVWQQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem")

hhp

Check Paul Maravelas’s book on letterpress:

Maravelas, Paul LETTERPRESS PRINTING, A MANUAL FOR MODERN FINE PRESS PRINTERS.

It is available from Oak Knoll Press:

[http://www.oakknoll.com/results.php?s\_ShowPics=1&search\_val=Maravelas&se...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091425/http:/www.oakknoll.com/results.php?s_ShowPics=1&search_val=Maravelas&search_fld=All&x=15&y=11 "http://www.oakknoll.com/results.php?s\_ShowPics=1&search\_val=Maravelas&search\_fld=All&x=15&y=11")

& Amazon seems to have a few available.

But read this book in conjunction with hands-on learning. Miss Tiffany is right.

powers

Thomas

A good online resource for a general intro is

[http://www.fiveroses.org/intro.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091425/http:/www.fiveroses.org/intro.htm "http://www.fiveroses.org/intro.htm")

One of the better all around manuals is

General Printing: An Illustrated Guide to Letterpress Printing by Glen U. Cleeton, Charles W. Pitkin, and Raymond L. Cornwell

Gerald

I found three rather detailed manuals on letterpress printing, including Maravelas’s and many of those listed at [http://www.fiveroses.org/intro.htm#Manuals](http://web.archive.org/web/20081006091425/http:/www.fiveroses.org/intro.htm#Manuals "http://www.fiveroses.org/intro.htm#Manuals"), in a library. I’ll look for an active letterpress shop too.
